discussion.content: So the ans is not ACD?

questions.question_text:
You are carrying out the RDBMS Security Store Configuration using the configuration Wizard
Which three actions can you perform with the Configuration Wizard during the process? (Choose three.)

choices.C: Populate the database tables with external LDAP users.
choices.B: Execute SQL scripts in WebLogic server's server/lib directory.
choices.A: Create tables in the data store.
choices.D: Test the connection to a back-end database.
choices.E: Allocate tablespace for the data store.

choices.A: The Oracle Notification Service is used to notify the data source of changes to RAC nodes.
choices.E: You can use any Oracle Thin database driver with a GridLink data source.
choices.B: The reaction is quick, because in using FCF all network timeouts are set very low.
choices.C: FCF is faster because it polls and tests connection, freeing the data source from these tasks.
choices.D: FCF requires the use and configuration of a database server in the GridLink data source.

questions.question_text:
GridLink data sources are designed for use with an Oracle RAC database. By using the Fast Connection Failover (FCF) pattern, GridLink data sources can quickly react when a RAC node goes down.
Which two statements are true? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: I agree, the option D needs modification
D. FCF requires the use and configuration of a database [server] Service in the GridLink data source.

choices.A: Data sources are targeted to a domain.
choices.D: A data source contains a connection pool.
choices.B: Data sources are bound in the JNDI tree of a server.
choices.E: A domain requires at least one data source.
choices.C: Data sources are based on the JMS specification.

discussion.content: Each data source contains a pool of connections to target databases. Connection objects represent physical connections to target data stores and are used by applications to issue SQL commands.

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true about WebLogic data sources? (Choose two.)

You need to configure WebLogic Server to satisfy the needs of your new application that will update more than one data set on several databases in the same transaction.
All updates will be committed or rolled back at the end of the transaction.
Which setting should be considered?

choices.B: WebLogic Server supports distributed transactions by default, so no specific settings are required.
choices.E: Enable Two-Phase Commit in each data source.
choices.A: Enable Use XA Data Source Interface in the transaction properties of each data source.
choices.D: Configure your data sources with the available XA-compliant driver for your DBMS.
choices.C: Split the transaction into multiple local transactions.

questions.question_text:
You require high availability for HTTP sessions in a web application. In addition, you have the following constraints:
There is little free memory on the machines hosting the cluster.
HA must be guaranteed even when multiple machines fall simultaneously.
You are not allowed to update the production databases schema.
Which is the best session persistence option?
